EVENT_NARRATIVE: Extreme snowmelt from heavy snowfall and extreme flows on the Portneuf River caused damage to the Chesterfield Reservoir spillway.  The old structure started to deconstruct and makeshift repairs were made to alleviate any significant flooding.   Cost to repair the damaged structure were estimated at around 1.5 million dollars.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Extreme snowmelt from heavy snowfall and extreme flows on the Portneuf River caused damage to the Chesterfield Reservoir spillway.  The old structure started to deconstruct and makeshift repairs were made to alleviate any significant flooding.   Cost to repair the damaged structure were estimated at around 1.5 million dollars.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Flooding due to the rise of the Big Wood River due to snowmelt and spring rains flooded parts of Hailey including War Eagle Drive, Flat Top Road, and Camp Creek Road.   Damages were estimated at 1.9 million dollars on Flat Top Road and Camp Creek Road.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Flooding due to the rise of the Big Wood River due to snowmelt and spring rains flooded parts of Hailey including War Eagle Drive, Flat Top Road, and Camp Creek Road.   Damages were estimated at 1.9 million dollars on Flat Top Road and Camp Creek Road.
Large hail and flash flooding occurred in the southern mountains.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Water was running over US Highway 91 near Banida.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Large hail and flash flooding occurred in the southern mountains.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The Idaho Transportation Department reported that a major landslide occurred which covered US-93 in both directions near Warm Springs Road at milepost 282 near Elk Bend.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Heavy rain fell from thunderstorms and produced a couple of debris flows Sunday evening.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The Salmon-Challis National Forest reported that a landslide had fully blocked the Salmon River Road, one mile southwest of Pine Creek.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Heavy rain fell from thunderstorms and produced a couple of debris flows Sunday evening.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The Beartrack Mine reported significant runoff on several of the nearby drainages, and the flood waters including soot from the 2022 Moose Creek wildfire overflowed several structures with no significant damage.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Anomalous atmospheric moisture with slow moving thunderstorms triggered a few debris flows in Lemhi County.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The mesonet station, JKPI1, 8.7 miles East of Lowman, ID measured 54 knots of wind.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Thunderstorms developed across southwest Idaho early Tuesday evening and produced |heavy rain and strong winds across portions of the Lower Treasure Valley, including the city of Boise. Social media, weather spotters, and emergency manager reports indicated flooding of many streets in downtown Boise and the North-End Boise area. Water overwhelmed  storm water drainages and flowed onto sidewalks and lawns. Water up to two feet deep left several vehicles stranded in the downtown area. The Connector, a major commuter route to downtown Boise was flooded, as were some apartments, and several buildings on the Boise State University campus. Rainfall rates over one inch an hour occurred with localized  rainfall totals up to 1.85 inches between 6 PM and 10 PM MDT. ||Blowing dust reducing visibility and high winds formed with a strong outflow boundary near the Nevada border around 5pm MDT. Wind damage was reported from Grandview, ID to downtown Meridian, ID.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Two reports of one inch hail from a thunderstorm in the area. The storm also caused ponding on roadways and widespread minor damage. The damage included tree limbs and downed power lines. It also damaged docks and boats along Lake Coeur D'Alene. An estimated 1700 customers lost power. Max wind gusts recorded was 39 MPH in Coeur D'Alene.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Widespread thunderstorm activity across North Idaho. It brought several reports of damage, power outages, and large hail. It briefly generated a funnel cloud in the North of Hayden Idaho.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Two observer reported seeing a funnel cloud. The first was North of Hayden. 15 minutes later another report was submitted Northwest of Post Falls. There was no damage reported.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Widespread thunderstorm activity across North Idaho. It brought several reports of damage, power outages, and large hail. It briefly generated a funnel cloud in the North of Hayden Idaho.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Kalispell Boat Launch and boat at Priest Lake damaged and dislodged from strong wind gusts.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Widespread thunderstorm activity across North Idaho. It brought several reports of damage, power outages, and large hail. It briefly generated a funnel cloud in the North of Hayden Idaho.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Funnel cloud photographed in Dubois.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Severe thunderstorm winds and funnel clouds occurred on the 8th.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: A 59 mph thunderstorm outflow wind measured at INL Specific Manufacturing site.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Severe thunderstorm winds and funnel clouds occurred on the 8th.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The mesonet station, RYCI1, 7.6 miles northwest of Reynolds, ID measured 0.50 inches of heavy rain.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: An upper level low brought significant wraparound precipitation and isolated supercells to the region. Extremely heavy rainfall was reported with these sets of storms.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Flash flooding impacted several streets and avenues of Lewiston. It stalled vehicles and caused debris build up in the area. A local emergency was declared from damages sustained during the event. Half an inch of rain fell in 15 minutes from 1330LST to 1345LST.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A slow moving thunderstorm moved over the Lewiston Idaho area and caused flash flooding. The KLWS ASOS recorded 0.68 inches of rain from 1250LST to 1356LST. Strong winds also knocked down several trees in Latah County.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Thunderstorm winds knocked down power lines and blew transformers. The report was along Snake River Avenue.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A slow moving thunderstorm moved over the Lewiston Idaho area and caused flash flooding. The KLWS ASOS recorded 0.68 inches of rain from 1250LST to 1356LST. Strong winds also knocked down several trees in Latah County.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Latah county dispatch reported numerous large trees down at Pines RV Park. Several vehicles and RVs were damaged by fallen trees. Nine people suffered minor injures.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Forest Service road 135 washed away near the intersection of Bear Creek and Antelope Pass Roads. Rainfall combined with snow melt continued to create flooding in the Salmon Challis National Forest.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: Forest Service road 135 washed away near the intersection of Bear Creek and Antelope Pass Roads.   Rainfall combined with snow melt continued to create flooding in the Salmon Challis National Forest.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The mesonet station, WAGI1, near Featherville, ID measured 0.56 inches of heavy rainfall.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A nearly stationary upper level low over the Four Corners region brought periods of heavy rain and thunderstorms which caused localized urban flooding in south central Idaho. Rainfall totals were around 0.50 inches, but the previous days rainfall made areas more prone to localized flooding.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Observer shared photo on social media of one inch sized hail stone around 1520LST. The storm also knocked out power Northwest of Hope Idaho.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A strong thunderstorm moved through the lower portion of Lake Pend Oreille on June 13 bringing large hail and wind damage.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: The public submitted several photographs of a tornado touched down north of Grace near US Highway 30.   It was a weak tornado and subsequent surveys noted zero damage as the tornado was in an open field.
EPISODE_NARRATIVE: A verified tornado, severe thunderstorm winds and large hail all occurred on the 23rd.

EVENT_NARRATIVE: Consalus fire started on June 30 by lightning. It continued through the end of the June. It has burned 475 acres of timber.
